SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient
Class ServerContext

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient.ServerContext

public class ServerContext
extends Object

Contains all session data concerning the server. Also contains a session data container for external use only. External users can utilize this container to store server related (session) data for the duration of the connection.

Only the server's id and the session data container is exposed publicly. The server id is determined during construction so that even when the connection is lost, external users can still access the server's id without connection exceptions.

Instances of this classes act as unique identifiers for client sockets, doing so allows executable message objects to access the server's session data without needing the Socket or InetAddress to identify the client.

This context keeps information about the server which may remain accessible even when the client or server has disconnected.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

Field Detail

serverEndpoint

private final ServerEndpoint serverEndpoint
Server to which this context is dedicated to. Used to read from and write to.

serverInetAddress

private final InetAddress serverInetAddress
Server id to which context is dedicated to. Acquired from serverInetAddress. Kept separate for when the socket has been closed already and the user still wants to know the original server id.

serverSaidByeBye

private volatile boolean serverSaidByeBye
Flag that indicated whether the client has sent a 'Bye Bye' notification to gracefully close the connection, or when the connection was lost somehow.

sessionData

private final Map<Object,Object> sessionData
A session scoped data container for external use only. Users can access this container to store temporary data concerning the current server connection, until the connection is lost and the context destroyed.

Constructor Detail

ServerContext

public ServerContext(ServerEndpoint serverEndpoint)
Stores the given server endpoint and saves its InetAddress for later use (in case the endpoint is being closed and we lose the ability the query for the InetAddress).

Parameters:
serverEndpoint - The server with which we have established a communication channel.
